body:

Kennesaw State University College of Computing and Software Engineering Search KSU MyKSU A-Z Index Directories Campus Maps Apply Visit Give Search Menu About KSU Academics Admissions Athletics Campus Life Research Global Getting Started Course Schedules Labs and Assignments Resources FYE Policies Office Hours Faculty and Staff Tutoring Submission Guidelines Pseudocode CSE 1321 Guide Pseudocode Step by Step FYE Feedback Search KSU CCSE First Year Experience / Faculty and Staff Getting Started Course Schedules Labs and Assignments Resources FYE Policies Office Hours Faculty and Staff Tutoring Submission Guidelines Pseudocode CSE 1321 Guide Pseudocode Step by Step FYE Feedback Faculty and Staff Lecturers (J-353D) and GTAs (J-352) Name Position Dexter Howard Dexter Howard Senior Lecturer of Software Engineering and Game Development Position: Senior Lecturer of Software Engineering and Game Development Phone: (470) 578-5618 Email: dhowar48@kennesaw.edu Location: J 353D FYE Coodinator Enda Sullivan Enda Sullivan Lecturer of Software Engineering Position: Lecturer of Software Engineering Phone: (470) 578-6005 Email: esulli13@kennesaw.edu Location: R2 309 Kaleigh Kendrick Kaleigh Kendrick Lecturer of Software Engineering Position: Lecturer of Software Engineering Phone: (470) 578-5618 Email: kkendri3@kennesaw.edu Location: J 353D Douglas Malcolm Douglas Malcolm Lecturer of Computing Position: Lecturer of Computing Phone: (470) 578-5618 Email: dmalcol1@kennesaw.edu Location: J 353D Nicholas Murphy Nicholas Murphy Lecturer of Computing and Software Engineering Position: Lecturer of Computing and Software Engineering Phone: (470) 578-3433 Email: nmurphy1@kennesaw.edu Location: J 342 Ermias Mamo Ermias Mamo Lecturer of Computer Science Position: Lecturer of Computer Science Phone: (470) 578-3790 Email: emamo@kennesaw.edu Location: J 370 FYE Chain of Command We encourage all students to initially speak with their instructors as an initial
                     step in resolving any classroom/lab issue. Instructors are your best option for improving anything with which you are having
                           difficulty in your classes. Below is the FYE "Chain of Command" for issue resolution, which students must follow: Labs: Lab instructor Lab "Instructor of Record" (check with your lab instructor) Course Coordinator (CSE1321 - Prof. Douglas Malcolm, CSE1322 - Prof. Enda Sullivan) FYE Program Coordinator (Prof. Dexter Howard) Department Chair (Prof. Chi Zhang) CCSE Dean (Prof. Sumanth Yenduri) Lectures: Lecture instructor Course Coordinator (CSE1321 - Prof. Douglas Malcolm, CSE1322 - Prof. Enda Sullivan) FYE Program Coordinator (Prof. Dexter Howard) Department Chair (Prof. Chi Zhang) CCSE Dean (Prof. Sumanth Yenduri) University Contact Info Kennesaw Campus 1000 Chastain Road Kennesaw, GA 30144 Marietta Campus 1100 South Marietta Pkwy Marietta, GA 30060 Phone 470-KSU-INFO (470-578-4636) kennesaw.edu/info Information For Current Students Future Students Faculty & Staff Community & Visitors Alumni & Friends Business & Industry Our Initiatives Global Affairs Diversity & Inclusion Community Engagement Sustainability Online Learning Related Links Libraries Arts, Culture and Museums Job Opportunities Degrees, Majors & Programs Financial Aid Registrar Housing Privacy Statement / Accreditation / Advisories / Reporting Hotline / Open Records / Human Trafficking Notice / Feedback / Text Only © 2021 Kennesaw State University. body:

Show your passion for
                           your team by proudly sporting KSU colors. Post your photo with #CollegeColorsDay on
                           social media. Be Black and Gold, Proud and Bold every day, but especially on Friday,
                           Sept. 3. See College Colors Scrappy-Style News + More News COVID-19 Info and Resources Kennesaw State hosting 20th anniversary Sept. 11 events Kennesaw State volleyball hosting Griffin's Game Sept. 10 Kennesaw State's Zuckerman Museum of Art to open fall exhibitions Events + More Events Presidential Task Force On Race The Presidential Task Force on Race is comprised of student, faculty, staff and alumni
                              leaders who are working to lead KSU toward meaningful change for our community and
                              beyond. Read More > Global Affairs The Division of Global Affairs is a multi-departmental organization that spearheads
                              programs designed to connect KSU students to the world, and vice versa. Read More > Diversity & Inclusion A welcoming, diverse, and inclusive climate is critical to attaining KSU’s research,
                              scholarship, teaching, and engagement goals. Read More > Online Learning Designed and taught by KSU faculty, distance learning at KSU offers high quality degree
                              options with distance learning convenience and flexibility. Read More > Community Engagement Community Engagement connects university resources with those of the public and private
                              sectors to enrich scholarship, research, and contribute to the public good. Read More > Veterans KSU strives to be one of the nation’s top military friendly schools by offering a
                              wide range of veterans-focused educational and support services.
